sen.j: 林 滝野（はやし たきの）は、与謝野鉄幹、正富汪洋の妻。
sen.e: Takino HAYASHI was Tekkan YOSANO's and later Oyo MASATOMI's wife.
Takino HAYASHI was Tekkan YOSANO's and later Oyo MASATOMI's wife.
Takino HAYASHI was Tekkan YOSANO's and later Oyo MASATOMI's wife.
She was born in Tokuchi, Yamaguchi City.
She was born in Tokuchi, Yamaguchi City.
She was born in Tokuchi, Yamaguchi City.

sen.j: 徳山女学校（のちの山口県立徳山高等学校）に在籍時に、当時そこの教師であった与謝野鉄幹と恋愛関係に陥り、同棲、一子萃（あつむ）を設ける。
sen.e: She had a son Atsumu when she was living together with Tekkan YOSANO without getting married who was the teacher at the Tokuyama girl's school (later Yamaguchi Prefectural Tokuyama Koto Gakko (high school) whom she fell in love.

While she was studying at Tokuyama girl's school (later Yamaguchi Prefectural Tokuyama Koto Gakko (high school), she fell in love with Tekkan YOSANO, a teacher of the school, began to live together without getting married, and gave birth to her son Atsumu.

While she was studying at Tokuyama girl's school (later Yamaguchi Prefectural Tokuyama Koto Gakko (high school), she fell in love with Tekkan YOSANO, a teacher of the school, began to live together without getting married, and gave birth to her son Atsumu.

sen.j: のち、二人で東京に出奔。
sen.e: Later, she ran away to Tokyo with him.
Later, she ran away to Tokyo with him.
Later, she ran away to Tokyo with him.

sen.j: 鉄幹の二度目の妻となる。
sen.e: She became Tekkan's second wife.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れです。訳を追記しました。
sen.e: She became Tekkan's second wife.

sen.j: 鉄幹とともに雑誌「明星」を創刊。
sen.e: She started publishing Myojo magazine with Tekkan.
She started publishing Myojo magazine with Tekkan.
She started publishing Myojo magazine with Tekkan.

sen.j: 初期の編集発行人の1人になる。
sen.e: She was one of the editors of the early-time magazines.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れです。訳を追記しました。
sen.e: She was one of the editors of the early-time magazines.

sen.j: のち、鉄幹の心が与謝野晶子に移ると共に、鉄幹に愛想を尽かし、1901年（明治34年）離婚。
sen.e: She divorced Tekkan in 1901 after disgusted with him when he courted Masako YOSANO.
She divorced Tekkan in 1901 being disgusted with him when he courted Masako YOSANO.
She divorced Tekkan in 1901 being disgusted with him when he courted Masako YOSANO.

sen.j: その後、正富汪洋と結婚。
sen.e: Later, she remarried to Oyo MASATOMI.
Later, she remarried Oyo MASATOMI.
Later, she remarried Oyo MASATOMI.

sen.j: このとき、正富が住んでいた家は、作家、樋口一葉の元居宅（丸山福山町4番地、その後、森田草平もここに住んだ）である。
sen.e: The house where MASATOMI was living was the same house where Ichiyo HIGUCHI lived (4 banchi Maruyama Fukumayamachi, where Kusahei MORITA later lived).
The house where MASATOMI was living was the same house where Ichiyo HIGUCHI had lived (4 banchi Maruyama Fukuyamamachi, where Kusahei MORITA later lived).
sen.cmt: HIGUCHI livedをHIGUCHI had livedに変更（hadを追加）、FukumayamachiをFukuyamamachiに変更
sen.e: The house where MASATOMI was living was the same house where Ichiyo HIGUCHI had lived (4 banchi Maruyama Fukuyamamachi, where Kusahei MORITA later lived).
Literature monument
Literature monument
Literature monument

sen.j: 林滝野の出生地に文学碑がある。
sen.e: There is a literature monument in her place of birth.
There is a literature monument in her place of birth.
There is a literature monument in her place of birth.

sen.j: 碑文「詩天九重、与門大学」は堀口大学によるもの。
sen.e: The inscription on the stone monument that reads "Shiten Kokonoe, Yomon Daigaku" was a work of Daigaku HORIGUCHI.
The inscription on the stone monument that reads "Shiten Kokonoe, Yomon Daigaku" was a work of Daigaku HORIGUCHI.
The inscription on the stone monument that reads "Shiten Kokonoe, Yomon Daigaku" was a work of Daigaku HORIGUCHI.

sen.j: 所在地は山口県山口市徳地伊賀地。
sen.e: The stone monument is located in Iga Province, Yamaguchi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture.
The stone monument is located in Iga, Yamaguchi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture.
The stone monument is located in Iga, Yamaguchi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture.
